Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.handler

Interface UidlState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    POP3Connection
    public interface UidlState
    Operations available when responding to a UIDL command.

    This interface is provided to TransactionHandler.uidl(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.Mailbox, int, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.handler.UidlState) and allows the handler to return unique identifiers for messages.

    UIDs must be unique within a mailbox and persist across sessions (RFC 1939 Section 7).

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    TransactionHandler.uidl(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.Mailbox, int, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.handler.UidlState)

      Writer for multi-line UIDL response.

    • Method Detail

      • sendUid

        void sendUid​(int messageNumber,
             java.lang.String uid,
             TransactionHandler handler)
        Sends the UID for a single message.

        Sends a +OK response with the message number and unique ID: +OK nn uid

        Parameters:
        messageNumber - the message number
        uid - the unique identifier
        handler - continues receiving transaction commands

      • beginListing

        UidlState.UidlWriter beginListing()
        Begins a multi-line UID listing for all messages.

        Sends a +OK response header and returns a writer for sending individual message UIDs. Call UidlWriter#end() when done.

        Returns:
        a writer for sending message UIDs

      • noSuchMessage

        void noSuchMessage​(TransactionHandler handler)
        The requested message does not exist.
        Parameters:
        handler - continues receiving transaction commands

      • messageDeleted

        void messageDeleted​(TransactionHandler handler)
        The requested message has been deleted.
        Parameters:
        handler - continues receiving transaction commands

      • error

        void error​(java.lang.String message,
           TransactionHandler handler)
        Reports an error accessing the mailbox.
        Parameters:
        message - the error message
        handler - continues receiving transaction commands
